Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Rabbi Aryeh Rockove, Congregation Zkhal  Nachlas Avos located at 11325 Myrtle Avenue, Jamaica, NY 11418.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Schulman.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Pastor Raymond Serrano, Life Together Works NYC located at 2347 Lafayette Avenue, Bronx N.Y. 10473.


The Majority Leader and the Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farias) moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the record..

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 26, 2024 be adopted as printed by Council Member Gutiérrez.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Gutierrez moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 26, 2024 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Communication from the Queens County Democratic Committee recommending the name of Jose M. Araujo to the Council regarding his appointment to the office of Commissioner of Elections of the Board of Elections pursuant to § 3-204 (4) of the New York State Election Law.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Jose M. Araujo - Democratic Elections Commissioner for Queens County.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to information about the maternal mortality and morbidity review committee
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Coupled on General Orders
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Information about the maternal mortality and morbidity review committee.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to written lactation room accommodation policies
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Coupled on General Orders
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Written lactation room accommodation policies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to develop and distribute parenting resource materials to parents and guardians of newborn children
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Coupled on General Orders
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to develop and distribute parenting resource materials to parents and guardians of newborn children.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation to increase Medicaid reimbursement to cover eight pre- and post-natal visits, as well as delivery support by doulas.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Women and Gender Equity
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Increase Medicaid reimbursement to cover eight pre- and post-natal visits, as well as delivery support by doulas.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.2898A/A.4017A, the Chisholm Chance Act, which would establish a plan to address the severe maternal morbidity crisis in Brooklyn and the Bronx.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Women and Gender Equity
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Chisholm Chance Act (S.2898A/A.4017A)

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Reporting on domestic violence emergency and tier II shelters.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Designating March 14 annually as Innocent 11 Remembrance Day in the City of New York.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations, State & Federal Legislation

Items.MatterName: Requiring bird friendly materials in certain existing buildings.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Limited hoist machine operator license requirements for rotating telehandlers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to training local entities on legislative process and rules of parliamentary procedure
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations, State & Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Training local entities on legislative process and rules of parliamentary procedure.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to requiring the inclusion of businesses owned by persons of Middle Eastern and North African descent in future disparity studies
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Requiring the inclusion of businesses owned by persons of Middle Eastern and North African descent in future disparity studies.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Children and Youth

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the sale of certain gift cards that lack chip-and-PIN technology.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to timely retrieve stored sexual offense evidence collection kits
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Police department to timely retrieve stored sexual offense evidence collection kits.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the integration of mental health professionals into public service answering points
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the integration of mental health professionals into public service answering points.

Items.MatterName: Practice of natural hair care and braiding (S.8573/A.8624-A).

Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of consumer and worker protection to confirm receipt of complaints related to fair work practices and to notify the person or entity under investigation of the receipt of the complaint.

Items.MatterName: Congress to pass and the President to sign a law to set minimum age to buy all firearms from licensed dealers or private individuals at 21.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the collection and sale of organic waste and compost by community composters
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Collection and sale of organic waste and compost by community composters.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of transportation to install e-bicycle battery stations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of transportation to install e-bicycle battery stations.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the New York State Governor to sign, S.6657A/A.7978, to amend the Vehicle and Traffic Law, in relation to registration fees for certain vehicles
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Amend the Vehicle and Traffic Law, in relation to registration fees for certain vehicles (S.6657A/A.7978).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a watch list of commercial landlords determined to have knowingly leased premises to, or otherwise allowed the use of premises by, unlicensed sellers of cigarettes, electronic cigarettes, tobacco products, or illicit cannabis
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Watch list of commercial landlords determined to have knowingly leased premises to, or otherwise allowed the use of premises by, unlicensed sellers of cigarettes, electronic cigarettes, tobacco products, or illicit cannabis.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.9747/S.9209, to amend the New York State Vehicle and Traffic law, in relation to the regulation of the operation of motorized scooters
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Amend the New York State Vehicle and Traffic law, in relation to the regulation of the operation of motorized scooters (A.9747/S.9209).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notifying interested parties of the recording of certain real estate instruments
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Notifying interested parties of the recording of certain real estate instruments.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a study on a program to make bridge loans available to awardees of capital funding from the city
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Study on a program to make bridge loans available to awardees of capital funding from the city.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Congress to pass, and the President to sign, S.1/H.R.11, the Freedom to Vote Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations, State & Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Freedom to Vote Act (S.1 and H.R. 11)

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías).

There were 50 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.
The Majority Leader (Council Member Farías) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.
At this point, the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Wednesday, October 23, 2024.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Application number N 240290 ZRY (City of Yes Zoning for Housing Opportunity) submitted by New York City Department of City Planning, pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, modifying multiple Sections to expand opportunities for housing within all zoning districts, Citywide.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Zoning and Franchises
Items.MatterName: Zoning, City of Yes for Housing Opportunity (N 240290 ZRY)

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Orders Calendar and voted separately:

Int. No. 956-C,  VOTE: 49-1-0
Negative: Council Member Yeger.

See files for individual votes.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
